channel.title: Home page of Maciej Lechowski
channel.description: Home page of Maciej Lechowski; blog, open source projects; c++, python, go, emacs, linux

item.title: Building a video game in C for a weekend game jam
item.description: Summary of building a video game entry for Ludum Dare 46 game jam. Top-down survival shooter in C and SDL.

item.title: How to use git submodules and CMake to install C++ libraries?
item.description: Install a C++ header-only library with git submodules and CMake.

item.title: Stay paranoid and trust no one. Overview of common security vulnerabilities in web applications
item.description: Stay paranoid and trust no one. Common security issues in web applications explained with Python and Django. Examples of SQL injection and command injection. Cross-site scripting, and other common vulnerabilities.

item.title: Static websites in Golang and Rust
item.description: How to generate static page websites in go?

item.title: How to connect to a host Postgres database from a Docker container?
item.description: Set up a Docker container running a web service that connects to a Postgres database running on the host system.

item.title: Building a Postgres GUI client with C++ and GTK (SanchoSQL)
item.description: SanchoSQL - Postgres GUI client with C++ and GTK

item.title: Setting up CI for a C++ application with Docker
item.description: How to set up continuous integration for a C++ application with Docker and open source CI service?

item.title: Debugging with git bisect
item.description: How to debug your code with git bisect

item.title: Making a turn-based strategy game in C++ in 72 hours
item.description: A turn-based strategy game developed for Ludum Dare 42 game jam in C++ and SFML.

item.title: When the compiler fixes your mistakes
item.description: I have been working on a new feature for my terminal-based application launcher. I want to be able to search for programs and run them from within Emacs using xstarter. In this post, I'll describe a strange experience I have had fixing a bug.

item.title: On the benefits of a text-based user interface
item.description: Modern user interfaces offer stunning graphic styles and impressive visual effects. However, there's a category of applications that is seemingly outdated but yet offers unparalleled productivity and unique experience in interaction with a computer.

item.title: How to set up googletest library from source?
item.description: The following guide provides instructions on how to compile and add googletest to a C++ project. It will use pkg-config to obtain compiler flags and can be used with a build system such as cmake.
